title: 105_hr2985
content: Aliens are ineligible for visas and excluded from admission for nonpayment of child support. Aliens can be deemed inadmissible for failing to pay child support exceeding $5,000 as per the Immigration and Nationality Act. The amendment to the payment agreement will apply to visas issued 180 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 2. REMOVAL OF ALIENS FOR NONPAYMENT OF CHILD SUPPORT. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to make any alien deportable if they fail to pay child support exceeding $5,000. The amendment will take effect 180 days after the enactment of the Act. Aliens may be ineligible for naturalization if they fail to pay child support as legally obligated. The amendment also allows legal process serving in child support cases on certain arriving aliens. The amendment authorizes immigration officers to serve legal process in child support cases on arriving aliens applying for admission to the United States. The term 'legal process' refers to any writ, order, summons, or similar process issued by a court or administrative agency in the United States. The effective date for this amendment is 180 days after the enactment of the Act, applying to aliens seeking admission to the US. SEC. 5. AUTHORITY TO OBTAIN INFORMATION ON CHILD SUPPORT PAYMENTS BY ALIENS. Amends Section 453(h) of the Social Security Act to allow the Immigration and Naturalization Service to request information on delinquent child support payments from the Federal Case Registry of Child Support Orders.
